title: How to Put Windows XP on your PSP

steps.headline: Connect your PSP to your PC using the USB cable.
Open "My Computer" on your PC and make a note which Letter drive your PSP is connected to.
On your PC go to download.com's download page
This should open a page to download, "PspWxp 1.02."
Click on "Download Now" to download the zip file containing Windows XP for your PSP.
Download it and save it to any location on your PC.
Open the zip file which will be called "pspWxp103.zip"
Select the letter of the drive that your PSP is connected to.
It will begin to transfer the files required to your PSP, which may take a few minutes.
Once it is complete a message will pop up saying "Finished Copying," so click "OK," to continue.
steps.description: But if an ERROR message appears, then you might want to try re-installing. If re-installing does not work then your version of Windows does not support this PSP software and will not run correctly!

steps.headline: Disconnect your PSP from the PC.
Open the Internet Browser on the PSP
Enter -   file:/pspWxp/index.htm  - into the address bar.
Use it just like you would Windows on your PC.
This little hack also works very well on Archos devices, especially the Archos 605 WiFi.

text: Connect your PSP to your PC using the USB cable.  Open "My Computer" on your PC and make a note which Letter drive your PSP is connected to. For example, "G:" On your PC go to download.com's download page  This should open a page to download, "PspWxp 1.02."  Click on "Download Now" to download the zip file containing Windows XP for your PSP.  Download it and save it to any location on your PC.  Open the zip file which will be called "pspWxp103.zip"  Double click on the "Install" .exe file.  Select the letter of the drive that your PSP is connected to.  Click "OK"  Click "Yes" to install it.  It will begin to transfer the files required to your PSP, which may take a few minutes.  Once it is complete a message will pop up saying "Finished Copying," so click "OK," to continue. But if an ERROR message appears, then you might want to try re-installing. If re-installing does not work then your version of Windows does not support this PSP software and will not run correctly! Disconnect your PSP from the PC.  Open the Internet Browser on the PSP  Enter -   file:/pspWxp/index.htm  - into the address bar.  Use it just like you would Windows on your PC.  Have fun.  This little hack also works very well on Archos devices, especially the Archos 605 WiFi.
